Class RecursiveMethods

java.lang.Object
RecursiveMethods
public class RecursiveMethods
extends java.lang.Object
This class' all methods are static and work recursively.

  • Method Details

    • reverseString

      public static java.lang.String reverseString​(java.lang.String input)
      Words will be reversed It stops there is no word other than current input
      Parameters:
      input - the sentence that word's inside of it will be reversed
      Returns:
      string reversed

    • elfishWord

      public static boolean elfishWord​(java.lang.String input)
      Method that checks the word elfish or not
      Parameters:
      input - word
      Returns:
      elfish or not

    • elfishRecursive

      private static boolean elfishRecursive​(java.lang.String input, boolean e, boolean l, boolean f)
      Recursive method that checks every word is e, l or f. It stops at the end of the string
      Parameters:
      input - word string
      e - contains e letter
      l - contains l letter
      f - contains f letter
      Returns:
      e AND l AND f

    • recursiveSelectionSort

      public static void recursiveSelectionSort​(int[] arr, int n, int index)
      Finds the minimum element of the array and swaps it to current index Recursion must stop at the end of the array
      Parameters:
      arr - integer array
      n - size of the array
      index - position

    • findMinimumIndex

      private static int findMinimumIndex​(int[] arr, int i, int j)
      It starts to check from start position to end of the list and compares two indexes. Returns which index is minimum
      Parameters:
      arr - int array
      i - size of the array
      j - start position
      Returns:
      minimum index

    • calculateOperator

      private static int calculateOperator​(char operator, java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> operandStack)
      Calculate operation according to operator. It pops two element from stack. First one is right operand, other one is left operand.
      Parameters:
      operator - operation that will be applied
      operandStack - Stack that stores operands
      Returns:
      result of the operation

    • calculateOperatorReverse

      private static int calculateOperatorReverse​(char operator, java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> operandStack)
      Very similar to calculateOperator() but the operations that will be executed from right operand to left operand because this is prefix calculation
      Parameters:
      operator - operation that will be applied
      operandStack - Stack that stores operands
      Returns:
      result of the operation

    • isOperator

      private static boolean isOperator​(char ch)
      Checks char value is operator
      Parameters:
      ch - char value
      Returns:
      is operator or not

    • EvaluatePrefix

      public static int EvaluatePrefix​(java.lang.String expression) throws RecursiveMethods.SyntaxErrorException
      Calculates prefix expression
      Parameters:
      expression - String that is converted to prefix annotation
      Returns:
      result of the expression
      Throws:
      RecursiveMethods.SyntaxErrorException - if some error occurs in the stack

    • EvaluatePostfix

      public static int EvaluatePostfix​(java.lang.String expression) throws RecursiveMethods.SyntaxErrorException
      Calculates postfix expression Reverses expression and gets reversed postfix notation
      Parameters:
      expression - String that is converted to postfix annotation
      Returns:
      result of the expression
      Throws:
      RecursiveMethods.SyntaxErrorException - if some error occurs in the stack

    • prefix

      public static int prefix​(java.lang.String expression, java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> operandStack) throws RecursiveMethods.SyntaxErrorException
      Recursive method that calculates prefix notation. Takes every substring from start to whitespace. Checks it is operator or operand. If is operand push it to stack if is operator pop two elements from stack and calculates operation then push the result to the stack When there is no element to check, pops the result from stack and returns it
      Parameters:
      expression - prefix expression that is reversed
      operandStack - stack that stores operands
      Returns:
      result of the expression
      Throws:
      RecursiveMethods.SyntaxErrorException - Syntax Error

    • postfix

      private static int postfix​(java.lang.String expression, java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> operandStack) throws RecursiveMethods.SyntaxErrorException
      It is very similar to prefix method. Only difference is when calculates the operation it calls calculateOperator() method instead of calculateOperatorReverse() Recursive method that calculates postfix notation. Takes every substring from start to whitespace. Checks it is operator or operand. If is operand push it to stack if is operator pop two elements from stack and calculates operation then push the result to the stack When there is no element to check, pops the result from stack and returns it
      Parameters:
      expression - postfix expression
      operandStack - stack that stores operand values
      Returns:
      result of the expression
      Throws:
      RecursiveMethods.SyntaxErrorException - if there is no element to pop from stack or not valid character to be read, throws it

    • printPattern

      public static void printPattern​(int[][] arr, int size, int width)
      Method that prints array's elements spiral
      Parameters:
      arr - int array
      size - row size
      width - column size

    • recursivePrint

      private static void recursivePrint​(int[][] arr, int size, int row, int width, int column)
      Recursive method that prints all elements recursively
      Parameters:
      arr - int array
      size - row size
      row - current row index
      width - column size
      column - current column index

    • printTopLine

      private static void printTopLine​(int[][] arr, int i, int size, int row)
      Prints top line of two dimensional array
      Parameters:
      arr - int array
      i - start index
      size - condition
      row - row that will be printed

      private static void printRightLine​(int[][] arr, int j, int width, int size)
      Prints right line of the two dimensional array
      Parameters:
      arr - int array
      j - start index
      width - condition
      size - column that will be printed

      Prints bottom line of the two dimensional array
      Parameters:
      arr - int array
      p - start index
      width - condition
      row - row that will be printed

      Prints left line of the two dimensional array
      Parameters:

      k - start index
      column - condition
      row - row that will be printed
